critique: The document is an executive order extending the life of the President's Information Technology Advisory Committee. The tone is formal and legalistic. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is probably a sense of stability and continued progress in information technology. There isn't much emotional content here, so most scores will be low. Initial scores: Joy: 2, Sadness: 1, Anger: 1, Fear: 1, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 1. Revised scores: Joy: 3, Sadness: 1, Anger: 1, Fear: 1, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 1.
